question: In which year, the first Women's Cricket World Cup was held?
explanation: In the year 1973, the first Women's Cricket World Cup was held. The 1973 Women's Cricket World Cup was the first tournament of its kind, held two years before the first limited-overs World Cup for men in 1975. The competition was won by the hosts, England. The competition was the brainchild of businessman Sir Jack Hayward. England topped the group, including five victories and one defeat, while Australia were runners up with four wins.
